text.title: TREASURY S MULFORD BACKS DEBT CONVERSIONS
text.body: Assistant Treasury Secretary David Mulford he prefers debt conversion plans to help heavily indebted countries over quick fix political plans to help ease their debt burden In my view debt conversions or swaps into either equity or local debt claims provide preferable route to debt relief debtor nations particularly if combined measures to encourage new equity investment repatriation flight capital he told House Subcommittee on International Development Institutions Mulford criticized what he called large scale solutions to debt problems effecting many developing countries ranging debt forgiveness to creating new multilateral institutions lending While such approaches may some political appeal they impractical ultimately counterproductive he He debt conversions or swaps more effective because they eliminate interest service on converted debt create new jobs open up investment opportunities can help indebted countries overcome their own problems

text.author: By Russell Blinch Reuters
text.body: Canadian economic growth expected to slow further but improved trade picture should keep country recession economists The economy ready pct rate growth over course Carl Beigie Chief Economist at Dominion Securities Pitfield Ltd Statistics Canada reported gross domestic product grew pct fourth year continuous expansion but down s four pct final quarter GDP prices at annualized rates rose slight pct after expanding pct third quarter Essentially flat performance Warren Jestin deputy chief economist at Bank Nova Scotia Economist Wendy Smith Cork brokerage Nesbitt Thomson Bongard Inc it shows economy moving along very steadily s very promising number We weren t surprised we expected to see one bad quarter Canada but we don t think there be recession she added rise GDP below pct increase forecast by Federal Finance Minister Michael Wilson his budget month He also projected economy expand pct year Many economists less optimistic predicting growth likely be to pct range Statistics Canada also reported country s trade performance deteriorated sharply year as deficit current account rose to record billion Canadian dlrs previous year s shortfall dlrs The sharp increase deficit originated merchandise trade transactions where imports continued to advance strongly whereas exports were virtually unchanged federal agency statement merchandise trade surplus pared to billion dlrs billion dlrs But economist Cork expected upturn U S economy lead to increased demand Canadian goods help fuel country s modest expansion Nearly pct Canada s exports shipped to U S each year

text.title: BANK OF ENGLAND PROPOSES LIMITS ON UNDERWRITERS
text.author: By Norma Cohen and Geert Linnebank Reuters
text.body: The Bank England proposed banks Britain first time to seek authorization to be lead underwriters new issues euromarkets addition Bank proposed limits on amount credit risk firms can take on each new issue they lead manage proposed rules were outlined today consultative paper on large credit exposures taken by recognized banks deposit takers may be modified Bank rules could affect billions dollars eurobond securities issued each year billion dlrs new eurobonds were offered according to figures compiled by Euromoney magazine Up until now there been no restrictions on lead managing eurobond issues However eurobond market participants believe Bank England concerned intense competition market share may caused some firms to expose themselves to imprudent credit risk Competition market share been boon to issuers as banks compete to offer best terms But new rules suggest some constraints may be placed on competition as regulators attempt to ensure no bank takes on more risk than can handle Banking sources while Bank England reluctant to inhibit competition willing to accept some constraints order to ensure underwriters act prudently The Bank s assessment appropriateness bank s lead underwriting activity depend primarily upon skill experience lead underwriter particular market concerned Bank s proposal Once firm received permission to act as lead underwriter exposure be valued at one sixth face amount securities Nominal exposure exceeding pct capital must be reported to Bank England must be notified advance exposure over pct capital exposure be determined to exist maximum days following binding commitment to underwrite After any remaining exposure unsold securities be assessed at their full face value rules apply to syndicated loan facilities revolving credits or commercial paper Bank Bank also amended other aspects plans to strengthen supervisory powers over banks paper called comments professionals by March to allow their possible inclusion Banking Bill time planned final discussion Parliament scheduled before summer new Banking Bill updating Banking Act third leg Conservative government s legislation supervision financial institutions to feature alongside Financial Services Act aimed to bolster investor protection Building Societies Act put these institutions on equal footing banks proposed legislation abolish distinctions between recognised banks licensed deposit takers tighten legal controls making criminal offence to mislead supervisors Proposals to require banks to inform Bank England advance planned exposures excess pct their capital to Bank supervise exposures between pct capital were under debate paper showed However preliminary consultations bank representatives shown some initial proposals to be flawed Most proposed changes involved evaluating exposures on case by case basis rather than along general lines Amendments involved Bank s proposed treatment exposures by financial institutions acting as banker to other units their own group companies paper showed They also regarded treatment credit exposure to local governments other public sector entities exposures undertaken by banks subsidiaries banks Proposals on how to value securities given by debtor as collateral to credit were slightly changed paper showed Exposures taken on by banks acting as creditor within their own group companies usually be looked into on case by case basis under new proposals paper exposures to state owned industries other public sector authorities U K abroad should be given more lenient treatment credits to governments provided government gives unconditional repayment guarantees cautioned exposures to U K local authorities those guaranteed by British Export Credit Guarantee Department probably qualify such treatment On credits granted by banks subsidiary another bank earlier proposed pct capital ceiling could be exceeded individual cases But parent bank to give formal undertaking to take over exposure if problems were to occur state writing exposure retained subsidiary s balance sheet to meet precise group objectives paper On collateral security should normally only be taken into account when considering acceptability bank s exposure up to pct capital base The presence security taken on own be considered by Bank as acceptable reason exposure excess pct but only most exceptional circumstances even then to very limited extent

text.title: COFFEE MAY FALL MORE BEFORE NEW QUOTA TALKS
text.author: By Douglas Learmond Reuters
text.body: Coffee prices may to fall even lower to bring exporting importing countries once more round negotiating table to discuss export quotas ICO delegates traders failure night International Coffee Organization ICO producing consuming countries to agree export quotas brought sharp fall on international coffee futures markets today London May price reaching year low at one stage stg per tonne before ending day at stg down stg previous close New York May price down at cents lb Pressure now build up on producers returning ICO talks to sell coffee been held back hope negotiations establish quotas put floor under prices some senior traders ICO day average price stood at cents lb March compares target range to cents lb under system operating before quotas were suspended February year following sharp rise international prices caused by drought damage to Brazilian crop interview Brazilian Coffee Institute IBC President Jorio Dauster urged producers to panic they need to make hard commercial decisions If we failed at ICO at least we tried Dauster adding now time to go sell coffee But Brazil keeping marketing options open plans to make official estimate forthcoming crop next month Dauster too difficult to forecast now Trade sources put crop at over bags compared previous crop Brazil defining details public selling tenders coffee bought on London s futures market year basic condition be does go back to market in one go but sold over minimum six months breakdown ICO negotiations reflected split between producers consumers on how to set yardstick future quotas Consumers objective criteria like average exports stocks should determine producer quota shares Dauster All elements proposal were open to negotiation but consumers insisted they did want return to ad hoc way settling export quotas by virtual horse trading amongst producers whilst consumers waited corridors ICO Dauster stocks exports to ICO members non members all need to be considered when setting quotas Brazil like to apply coffee pact set ratio overall quota reflecting stock holdings simplistic misconception Brazil can dictate policy to other producers While consumer countries welcome to participate they cannot dictate quotas very difficult to allocate as different objective criteria achieve different share outs quota Dauster Other delegates there more open talking at ICO at least differences were hidden by bad compromise Consumer delegates they been prepared to accept producers offer to abandon quotas if proves impossible to find acceptable basis them We want basis quotas to reflect availability to encourage stock holding as alternative to buffer stock if supplies needed at later stage one delegate Some consumers claimed producer support consumer argument gaining momentum towards end ICO session but uncertain whether now collapse how much producers sink their differences should prices fall further remain depressed ICO executive board meets here March to April but both producer consumer delegates they doubt if real negotiations begin then board due to meet Indonesia June full council scheduled September More cynical traders pressure market forces politics debt heavy Latin American producer countries could bring ICO members back around negotiating table sooner than many imagine case quotas could come into force during summer But most delegates traders quotas before October unlikely while Brazil s Dauster noted ICO continued although there were no quotas to clear difference between pressures already being felt by importers exporters consumers been happy to agree on formula future quotas even if could be imposed now At least way they they could show direct relationship between quotas availability contrast producers wanted stop gap quotas to plug seemingly bottomless market were prepared to allow these to lapse should lasting agreement be found Producers were offering us jam tomorrow but after their failure to discuss them year promises were insufficient we wanted cast iron commitment now one consumer

text.title: U S OFFICIALS SAY BRAZIL SHOULD DEAL WITH BANKS
text.author: By David Hume Reuters
text.body: The U S sticking moment to policy Brazil two weeks ago suspended debt payments to private banks should deal creditors governments U S officials I don t see any desire here to scurry around help Brazil until we get better sense what they trying to do senior administration official stated Brazil to do business through banks at point another official following assessment country s latest debt crisis official who asked his name be used National Security Council Treasury State departments other agencies held meeting yesterday to discuss situation related development small regional banks made loans to Brazil other heavily indebted Latin American countries meet Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker here tomorrow Brazil billion dlrs debt shocked banks late month when stopped interest payments on billion dlrs owed to them until can work out problems Brazil s trade surplus main source foreign exchange dwindled recent months making difficult to service debt official interagency meeting called to discuss the general debt situation compare notes on Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro Funaro who told reporters here he wanted political discussion industrialized nations on Brazil s debt problems effort to obtain more faster lending official sources held discussions here on Friday Volcker Treasury Secretary James Baker other officials Another senior administration official he perplexed by Funaro s decision to discuss latest crisis governments creditor banks at time when Brazil danger losing short term credit lines We clear at all on his tactics To me seems bizarre just bizarre official One official today described Funaro s argument as nonsense there been considerable flow funds to Brazil country arrears Funaro Brazil acted to protect reserves but wanted to avoid confrontation consensus among administration officials seems to be Brazil s latest debt crisis result domestic economic problems Brazil special case but there s no doubt they be mess they re if they screwed up their economic policy senior official added Several regional banks meet Volcker tomorrow declined to comment because talks be held at Fed s suggestion Since they hosts we feel s up to them if they want to say something one regional bank official But other banking sources regional banks many refusing to continue lending to Latin America dissatisfied decisions major banks such as Citibank refinancing foreign debts sources added Volcker his part dissatisfied some major banks refusal to make interest rate concessions to Brazil other Latin American debtors like to see smaller creditor banks take more actve role rescheduling process

text.title: LEAF DISEASE HITS SRI LANKA RUBBER
text.author: By Feizal Samath Reuters
text.body: A leaf disease affecting seven pct Sri Lanka s rubber plantations may reduce output year raise currently depressed prices industry officials researchers told Reuters hectares rubber planted Rubber Research Institute RRI clone been hit by fungus corenes pora attacks roots tree kills leaves disease first discovered six months ago Trade sources say prices might boom once again if crisis leads to output below target tonnes year s output estimated at between tonnes Researchers say fungus could spread to other rubber clones if no immediate action taken The RRI considering asking estates to remove trees seriously affected by fungus because too late to use chemicals to kill disease Institute spokesman Senior industry research officials met yesterday at Padukka east here to discuss ways controlling fungus affecting estates mostly belonging to State Plantations Corp Janatha Estates Development Board two state owned groups account pct rubber land balance belonging to small private producers total hectares RRIC new clone propagated by Research Institute as high yielding recommended two years ago planting Only two state groups seriously planted these clones while smallholders preferred low yielding but older PBX Malaysian clones Officials at yesterday s crisis meeting decided to uproot only some affected trees while others be treated They declined to comment on other decisions taken Trade sources supplies improved past week but prices hit their lowest since December If there shortage rubber prices bound to rise spokesman company buying on behalf Soviet Union Rubber prices particularly crepe fell sharply by four rupees kilo between December March best crepe one X traded at rupees kilo averaged at week s auction Sheet prices fell by rupee same period Quantities offered at auction also fell to average tonnes per auction month tonnes December because wintering early February producing areas Over tonnes were offered at Tuesday s auction supply position showing improvements Trade sources smaller availability rubber month did raise prices as on previous occasions Some factors like less storage space excess stocks meant we could buy much at auction until we disposed rubber we already one buyer Other sources there were few forward contracts speculative buying month while delays steamer arrivals aggravated problem European buyers delayed their purchases because winter closures factories also hope prices ease further They another problem could hit industry dry spell producing areas If inter monsoonal rains expected late March April delayed we further shortages one official But again could benefit prices buyer

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BUNDESBANK CHANGES RE

text.title: BUNDESBANK CHANGES REPURCHASE PACT SYSTEM
text.author: By Jonathan Lynn Reuters
text.body: The Bundesbank planning changes system by banks bid funds securities repurchase pacts to improve flexibility key open market instrument central bank officials Banking economists changes shorten tender process to two days three currently enabling Bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts shorter maturity if chooses to steer money market liquidity more flexibly changes probably come into force April Under current system banks must themselves specify at tender securities they sell to Bundesbank subsequent repurchase time consuming business Banks hold securities purpose safe custody accounts Landeszentralbank LZB regional central banks local offices Bundesbank at state level Some billion marks securities held such accounts at Hesse LZB covers Frankfurt area change to come into force next month allow Bundesbank access to these accounts to select bonds itself process legally comparable to direct debiting At present Bundesbank generally announces tender on Monday holds tender late on Tuesday morning announces result early Tuesday afternoon allocates funds Wednesday Bundesbank generally sets repurchase pacts running days But sometimes public holidays result longer pacts or longer tender periods being necessary instance Bundesbank announced tender Friday to be held today Wednesday crediting funds tomorrow Thursday advance announcement took into account carnival holiday Duesseldorf on Monday Frankfurt yesterday Tuesday Central bank officials money market dealers shortening tender process should be seen as purely technical no direct implications interest rates It credit policy matter but technical matter official at Hesse LZB Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl December security repurchase pacts proved much greater success since their introduction their present form two years ago praised their flexibility tender process changes make repurchase pact instrument even more flexible banking economists By speeding up tender process they make possible Bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts periods less than month something long sought by banks to respond to changing money market conditions With help instrument liquidity steering be refined but there won t be any effect on interest rates Berliner Handels und Frankfurter Bank economist Hermann Remsperger Bundesbank be able to react more quickly to money market developments but by steering liquidity interest rates he

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC MIDLAND RIGHTS ISSUE
reuters.text: MIDLAND RIGHTS ISSUE STILL EXPECTED SAY ANALYSTS LONDON March Midland Bank Plc s MDBL L results suggest its shares show further recovery potential although a rights issue is still expected in the next few months banking analysts said A rights issue of the order of mln stg is seen perhaps in June if there is no U K General election they added Midland Chairman Sir Donald Barron would not comment on the rights question at a news conference Earlier Midland reported pre tax profit of mln stg up from mln the previous year in line with market forecasts dealers said Midland shares were up p at p Midland said its results included Crocker National Corp for the first five months prior to its sale last May If results were restated excluding distortions stemming from the Crocker sale they would show a pre tax profit of mln stg compared with mln it said Barron said that after the sale of Crocker and restructuring during the last two years the group had put the past firmly behind us in and was now focusing our considerable resources on the exciting opportunities ahead Chief Executive Sir Kit McMahon said U K Operations were the main source of profits with pct or mln stg Both net interest income and non interest income were ahead of A key component in domestic asset growth was a pct rise in Midland s mortgage portfolio to billion stg comfortably exceeding a billion target McMahon said Overall sterling advances rose over pct to billion stg Pre tax profits in investment banking rose pct to mln stg despite the heavy start up and integration costs However this included the group s full range of activities in this area from its treasuries operations to its merchant bank to securities and gilts trading activities No breakdown of this figure was given although McMahon said venture capital activites contributed mln stg to profit He said the group s gilts trading was operating at a profit although its securities activities were not but would give no further details International banking profits rose pct to mln stg benefitting from past restructuring and good performances from European subsidiaries Crocker and the Bracton subsidiary created by Midland to work out Crocker s problem loans made a loss of mln stg in against a mln loss in Bracton assets now stood at mln dlrs and had been fully provisioned McMahon said Charges for bad and doubtful debts declined to mln stg against mln the previous year and the bank said that excluding Crocker it would have been mln McMahon noted that total cover for bad debts had increased to three pct of lendings in from pct in He said no evidence of increasing consumer credit delinquency and fewer U K Corporate defaults allowed for a lower domestic debt charge in McMahon said Midland s exposure in South America remained unchanged on with billion stg outstanding to Brazil billion to Mexico and mln to Argentina Following the lead of the other four major U K Banks Midland moved charges against lending to rescheduling countries from general to specific provisions This was the key factor behind a reduction in its tax rate to just under pct in from pct in McMahon said One major problem still to be faced by the bank was to further reduce its cost income ratio which is still well above its competitors at pct he added REUTER

text.title: FED DRAFTS CURRENCY RATE SWAP RISK GAUGE
text.body: The Federal Reserve Board voted unanimously to propose formula calculating risk interest rate currency swaps as part ongoing effort to come up new capital standard U S banks takes into account riskiness bank s loans other assets Fed officials identical proposal being issues today by Bank England Fed set day period public comment on plan proposal adopted today addresses only credit risks associated interest rate swaps forward foreign exchange contracts similar financial instruments Previously Fed Jan proposed series guidelines calculating risk other off balance sheet activities banks be required to take into account calculating minimum financial cushion they need to maintain Both guidelines set five broad categories risk loans other bank assets assigned to each level risk establish bank s minimum capital needs additional guidelines proposed today determine amount capital support required bank s current exposure given asset potential future exposure current exposure be measured by mark to market value asset reflect replacement cost Potential future increases replacement cost be calculated using credit conversion factors based on statistical analyses by staffs Bank England U S banking regulators Future exposure rise over life asset Fed staff risk gauge attempted to balance conflicting needs precision simplicity They ignore example relative volatility particular currencies involved exchange rate contracts Board officials new gauge could increase capital required largest money center banks principal participants these types activities They cautioned Fed board to take account potential impact plan on ability U S banks to compete world financial markets However staff concluded The credit risks inherent such contracts now constitute significant element risk profiles some banking organizations Fed proposal exempt all but largest participants market on grounds benefits including smaller banks be outweighed by costs Also excluded be interest rate foreign exchange contracts traded on organized exchanges Governor Martha Seger she concerned Japan involved U K U S effort to draft new capital rules

text.title: EC SOURCES DETAIL NEW FARM SOCIAL PACKAGE
text.body: The Ecu three year package social structural measures agreed early today by European Community farm ministers features plan to compensate farmers reducing output certain surplus products EC Commission sources ministers agreed under extensification scheme farmers qualify compensation if they cut output specific products by at least pct plan initially apply to cereals beef veal wine they added Cereals farmers to achieve their output cuts by reducing acreage while cattle farmers reduce their number head vinegrowers cut yield each case farmers to undertake to step up their capacity output other products surplus EC sources payment levels yet been fixed but be designed to compensate farmers loss profit on production they forego sources package also contains provisions payments to farmers who embark on program aimed at protecting or improving environment also mean compensatory allowances less favoured farming areas be extended to crops At present such allowances available only livestock package provide Ecus research into alternative farming techniques sources added At news conference EC Farm Commissioner Frans Andriessen Commission also working on proposals to enable EC member states to provide direct income supports relatively poor farmers Andriessen did give full details but member state aid be subject to strict criteria to avoid distortion competition EC payments aim to help farmers to survive difficult period while EC tackles problems surplus production Commission withdrew package agreed night proposals to pay early retirement pensions to farmers aged or over who gave up production Those who took their land completely out farm production rather than passing on to their heirs received more generous payments Andriessen Commission plans to present revised proposals along these lines effort to get scheme agreed

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC COFFEE TALKS FAILURE

text.title: COFFEE TALKS FAILURE SEEN PRESSURING U S
text.author: By Greg McCune Reuters
text.body: Failure talks on re establishing International Coffee Organization ICO coffee quotas week may put political pressure on United States particularly State Department to reassess position but U S unlikely to back away basic demand quotas be set by objective criteria U S officials Jon Rosenbaum assistant U S trade representative head Washington s delegation to talks told Reuters on his return London United States willing to resume coffee negotiations as early as April if necessary Rosenbaum United States be flexible discussing method establishing objective criteria any transition to new quotas but on basic aim establishing objective method setting quotas At ICO talks major consuming nations led by U S proposed future coffee export quota shares be calculated by formula incorporating producer s recent exportable production verified stocks while large producers led by Brazil proposed maintaining traditional ad hoc division shares consumer position effect reduced market share Brazil by far world s largest producer Rosenbaum administration continue to support legislation now before Congress allow U S customs service to monitor coffee imports as way to comply any future coffee quotas He Reagan administration be reviewing coffee policy situation following collapse London talks but nobody proposing we change our position However other U S government officials involved coffee policy they bracing diplomatic coffee market offensive producer countries led by Brazil Colombia to soften consumer position Knowing next crop fairly large Brazil kind want to test resolve other producers consumers one U S official U S official who asked to be identified Brazil Colombia may flood coffee market next few months effort to drive down prices pressure other countries particularly splinter group small producers who differed major producers London turn could lead to urgent appeals Latin American countries faced mounting debt problems to U S State department to National Security Council White House easing U S position U S officials State department major player setting U S coffee policy may then face conflicting pressures particularly politically sensitive U S allies Central America U S officials El Salvador Guatemala both backed Brazil Colombia at London talks resisting pressures quotas based on objective criteria But Dominican Republic Costa Rica joined splinter group agree to objective criteria There strong feeling among some State Department United States should continue to support splinter group producers who taken politically risky step opposing Brazil on objective criteria question U S officials Within consuming countries there also expected to be some pressure to reassess positions London U S supported by U K Netherlands West Germany Japan Australia New Zealand on issue objective criteria U S officials bloc represented enough votes among consuming nations to successfully prevent adoption producer proposals However U S sources West Germany s support at times qualified there some concern European Community could come under pressure to be more accommodative to producers future talks France backed Ivory Coast other African producers during talks softening EC stance make more difficult although impossible U S to block producer plans While political manuevering by small producers consuming countries be important U S officials key to any future outcome be Brazil s position U S officials blamed Brazil s intransigence failure talks more flexible position Brasilia be most important step toward agreement

government s economic planning Turkey s creditworthiness at risk over current account shortfall originally targeted at dlrs We must alleviate current account substantially to sustain creditworthiness we managed to secure over five years he added His comment echoed October s Organisation Economic Cooperation Development report on Turkey Ankara s case more medium term financing on better terms look achieve very visible improvement current account deficit he Tigrel surge public sector spending year also to blame high deficits Appropriations to government departments been cut by eight pct since sector borrowing requirement down to five pct GNP estimated pct More modest GNP growth five pct also targeted Tigrel Measures were being taken to encourage exports production incentives were being reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT GENERAL

text.title: TALKING POINT GENERAL MOTORS GM
text.author: By Steven Radwell Reuters
text.body: General Motors Corp staged explosive rally on Wall Street after share buyback program announced yesterday but analysts GM s future remains clouded by stiff competition erosion market share GM shares rose to active trading Analysts agreed investors liked repurchase program but they differed sharply over carmaker s long term prospects I m very positive on GM Jack Kirnan Kidder Peabody Co They re clearly committed to enhancing shareholder value However some analysts worry how GM pay buyback whether new models enable carmaker to recapture lost market share After market closed yesterday GM buy back pct common stock by end announcement sent investors today scrambling GM shares more than shares changing hands by mid day buyback plan caused several analysts bullish on stock to reiterate buy recommendations morning at least one increased his earnings estimates GM based on good performance expected new car models But David Healy Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc repurchase program positive The buyback doesn t really change earnings outlook puts more stress on balance sheet he since GM to borrow money to pay stock purchases stock should settle back down to around he added Healy projects GM earn five dlrs share dlrs compared to earnings dlrs Healy s numbers near low end Wall Street estimates range five dlrs to dlrs four dlrs to dlrs Like other analysts Healy sees GM s share domestic car truck market falling On balance GM cars selling as well as their competitors he late February GM car sales fell pct year ago period while competitors Ford Motor Co F Chrysler Corp C both posted increases But GM February sales showed improvement over January adding expects improvement coming months Overall GM s share U S car truck sales should fall to around or pct pct at end analysts numbers include imports Kidder Peabody s Kirnan cost reductions product improvements year should lead to positive cash flow by fourth quarter help GM finance buyback GM stock been real laggard now s rolling up sleeves getting serious I think there s major earnings surprise winds he Kirnan raised his earnings estimates slightly today part reaction to announced buyback sees GM earning dlrs year dlrs The company more concerned than ever improving their relative valuation respect to Ford Chrysler he Another positive stock GM s dividend currently five dlrs share annually gives higher yield than competitors Kirnan GM raise cash dividend to cts share next year he predicted But analyst Michael Lucky Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc U S car sales weaken GM s new products if successful only slow but halt erosion market share I believe their new cars be successful but only curtail losses market share fall to around pct by Lucky Philip Fricke Goldman Sachs Co falls middle bulls bears While he recommending GM stock he results improve until I m looking improvement year transition year GM he Fricke who estimates earnings at dlrs at dlrs cost cutting new car models affect results But key thing isn t so much what they earn year s momentum beyond year s important

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT JAPAN LOW GROWTH MODEL
text.author: By Eric Hall Reuters
text.body: Healthy growth corporate profits consumer spending two pillars on Japan rests hopes sustained economic growth both look rotten at core economists polled by Reuters Profits domestic consumption meant to replace exports as engine growth But close ties between corporate performance wages mean alternative economic model promises little but slower growth they Falling profits may lead to falling incomes turn cut sales further reduce profits Bank Japan latest outlook improved terms trade linked to strong yen help domestic demand grow steadily However happen only if household spending increased line value real financial assets due to stable prices or if corporate investment recovered as profits domestic sales improved compared those exports No clear sign such developments so far been evidenced central bank Poor business prospects reason why economic growth be slow even though Japan s terms trade improved sharply due to strong yen Economist David Pike Phillips Drew estimates unit cost prices fell pct while output prices fell only eight pct giving large price margin advantage domestic market as long as companies did pass advantage on to consumer year s gap almost percentage points between fall wholesale price index slight drop consumer prices shows gains improved terms trade been kept as profits by producers distributors economists however believe layer fat protect companies only short while As more firms seek more profits at home instead abroad already fierce domestic competition increase fueled by lower priced imports Retail prices fall Profit margins suffer December survey by top business organisation Keidanren confirms dim view taken by firms themselves companies polled key manufacturing sector almost pct thought high yen create drop production volume pct predicted drop corporate performance Keidanren economist Kazuyuki Kinbara Main counter measures cited by firms include cutting unprofitable operations reducing work to sub contractors which employ significant numbers workers holding down wages reducing bonuses government fears unemployment could soon double three pct now Unemployment slow wage growth obviously hurt sales But reduced bonuses worries individual financial security could be even more damaging Twice year bonuses provide wage earners what amounts to enforced lump sum savings encouraging them to buy large consumer products sparking sales bonanza To save funds some big firms begun form tied bonus forcing employees to spend on firm s own goods Economists also predict Japanese save less than average pct salary they do now On contrary poor outlook lower disposable income could strengthen resolve to put money aside old age illness education housing main drains on working man s salary government survey public opinion over pct citizens continue to economise Japan rapidly ageing population minimal social security workers fear poverty their old age Faced such vicious circle government s reflationary strategies severely limited commitment by ruling Liberal Democratic Party Finance Ministry to cut state debt resulted small supplementary budgets attempts to provide fiscal incentive without reducing revenue Independent economists been less than excited at results Provision monetary stimulus similarly limited pct discount rate so low politically impossible to cut further basic bank savings rate at only pct Bank Tokyo economist Haruo Muto Almost pct Japanese still hold their savings some kind deposit official figures show Moves to directly inject liquidity unproductive while firms planning cuts capital investment central bank well aware soaring stock land prices only current results high liquidity Fear inflation also limits policy options Political analysts ascribe Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone s big election victory largely to long period almost zero price inflation he found year attempts to impose sales tax to offset tax cuts arouses fierce voter opposition

text.body: Texas Railroad Commissioner James Nugent saying ailing oilpatch cannot wait Congress to act today urged Texas state lawmakers to adopt incentives to find new oil reserves to exempt severance taxes on oil produced stripper wells Nugent speech to Texas house representatives state must take initiative molding U S energy policy finding new ways to assist troubled oil producers His proposal to revitalize Texas oil industry exempt stripper wells produce barrels oil or less each day state s pct severance tax He majority Texas oil wells fall within stripper well category price swing two to three dlrs barrel can be crucial determining if well remains production Nugent also called state lawmakers to exempt new wildcat wells state severance tax up to five years as financial incentive to explore new oil reserves Secondary tertiary oil production expensive methods production inject water or gas into ground to recover oil should also be exempted severance tax Nugent His plan exempt existing secondary tertiary wells produce at rate less than three barrels day three years or until price oil reaches barrel We ve been sitting back waiting on two federal administrations to develop coherent energy policy nation to follow I say we waited long enough Nugent In other words let s tell Washington to either lead follow or get out way Nugent financial losses to state treasury by exempting marginal oil production state severance taxes be more than made up by stimulating new business oil supply service industry

reuters.unknown: A F RM f reute r f BC NEW BANK RULES TOUGHE

text.title: NEW BANK RULES TOUGHER THAN NEEDED DEALERS SAY
text.author: By Norma Cohen Reuters
text.body: U S U K bank regulators asking banks to set aside more reserves than necessary to cushion them against risks posed by interest rate currency swap transactions they carry swap dealers After viewing proposed guidelines released jointly today by Bank England Federal Reserve Board dealers effect regulators asking them to set aside reserves twice same risk Market participants days to respond to proposals Adoption stiffer capital requirements especially significant eurobond markets saw new issue volume billion dlrs according to figures compiled by Euromoney magazine While no firm figures exist dealers eurobonds estimate pct all new issues involved some swap arrangement Separately ISDA estimates billion dlrs worth swap transactions outstanding Kenneth McCormick co chairman International Swap Dealers Association ISDA President Kleinwort Benson Cross Financing Inc Association no comment study proposals What they proposing really double counting Patrick de Saint Aignan managing director swaps Morgan Stanley Co Instead he argues banks should either be required to hold percentage face value say one pct per year to maturity or to hold percentage cost replacing contract event counterparty default The potential risk factors very large relative to what we expected director at one U K merchant bank What they really doing asking you to capitalize now to borrow money now to cushion you against risk you might years now he added Adds title first paragraph Dealers also they believe banks covered by agreement such as those based Japan competitive advantage because they to pass costs on to customers Indeed regulators apparently also concerned exclusion other countries new requirements Federal Reserve Board Governor Martha Seger following approval proposed guidelines by Fed she concerned Japan involved U K U S effort to draft new capital rules Dealers they were somewhat relieved to see bank regulators recognized concept netting offsetting amounts receiveable payable to single counterparty against each other paper regulatory authorities recognize such arrangements netting may certain circumstances reduce credit risk Furthermore paper if netting agreement could be reached withstand legal tests might be willing to reduce capital requirements accordingly But dealers they fear regulators may insist on airtight netting agreement impossible to design One problem there never been major default swaps market So we don t know if any swap arrangements really stand up court one bank official

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC LEGISLATORS COOL TO N

text.title: LEGISLATORS COOL TO NEW STOCK TAX IDEA
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: Key tax budget lawmakers Wednesday expressed reservations suggested new securities tax aroused concern on Wall Street put pressure on brokerage stocks Grappling need to either raise taxes or cut federal spending to meet fiscal budget deficit target billion dlrs House Speaker Jim Wright suggested tax be studied as one way to raise more federal revenues Texas Democrat s idea as first presented to House Ways Means Committee chairman Dan Rostenkowski week tax sales purchases securities tax to percent raise to billion dlrs year Rostenkowski chief taxwriter considers too early to back any tax increase idea but agreed to add securities transfer tax to long list tax alternatives under review by congressional tax analysts spokesman Illinois Democrat repeatedly stressed year he reluctant to back tax increase so long as President Reagan maintains his staunch opposition First we ve got to decide whether to raise additional revenues Only then can we consider specific options At point nothing on or off table s just too early Rostenkowski statement He made no commitment to Wright private meeting Tuesday fact asked one House source idea presented only as something might or might be valuable he House Budget Committee chairman William Gray agreed another option to be looked at if Congress decided needed to raise revenues to reduce deficit aide Pennsylvania Democrat does intend to recommend specific tax proposals aide Budget Committee recommend certain amount revenue to be raised but leave to taxwriting committee decision on how taxes be raised securities transfer tax raise hefty amount revenue to ease Congress s difficult task trimming deficit by billion dlrs year to meet target But some Congress feared such tax could drive securities business offshore hurt U S investment there were uncertainties details tax Democrats united behind any budget alternatives so far year week they scheduled to discuss budget possible spending cuts or tax increases but no decisions anticipated congressional sources At same time without President Reagan s assent to general tax increase they left piecemeal taxes guaranteed to anger those who must pay We could just do all them one congressional source various tax ideas excise taxes securities taxes oil import fee others

industry weak mid February sales but eight domestic based car manufacturers still saw sales fall pct full month year GM whose sales been weakening several months took only pct domestic car sales February period compared pct year ago when sales entire industry were depressed ending major marketing incentive campaigns At same time rival Ford Motor Co F car sales period rose pct Chrysler Corp C up pct industry leader s slide even more marked full month as GM took only pct all car sales February including imports compared pct year ago Industry analysts domestic make cars sold seven selling days late February represented seasonally adjusted annualized rate units while sold month were at annual rate year industry sold record new cars including domestic makes But consumers taken breather Pontiac Buick divisions offer many their new car lines through April discount loan packages at rates ranging pct month contracts to pct month deals as alternative to cash rebates Among smaller U S text.body: Trading energy futures on New York Mercantile Exchange change dramatically over next five to years as market matures according to outgoing chairman Michel Marks Energy futures trading going through tremendous period transition five to years Marks adding volume soar international participation increase activity producing countries major oil companies speculators grow Marks steps down as chairman after nine year tenure when board elections held March He continue as chairman long range planning committee at NYMEX The priority next years operational efficiency versus years when new product development Marks Marks imperative NYMEX running out trading space to process greater volumes expeditiously order to handle growth volumes new contracts already planned Marks crude futures volume could more than double by end decade to contracts daily combined products volume could soar to contracts day Much increased activity come international sector according to Marks That s huge growth area he adding run gamut foreign producer countries to foreign independent operators He be difficult to develop futures contract based on internationally traded crude although he previously exchange exploring possibility Trying to develop futures contract any other crude besides West Texas Intermediate be tough task he Marks more likely futures contract based on international product rather than international crude be developed since products market more diverse He previously exchange studying possibility developing non U S deliverable products contract Other sources growth U S energy futures major oil companies already trade on NYMEX institutional funds such as investment houses pension funds insurance companies Marks The commodities markets become financial markets should pursue partnership financial intermediaries Marks He speculators increase their share energy futures markets coming years current share pct Hedgers as result lose some their pct share

tonne lowest since Bra Kanon estimated at at least billion CFA francs billion dlrs overall loss revenues earned by Ivory Coast all commodities exports year if slide on world markets continues He African Coffee Organisation IACO to speak on behalf continent s producer nations at London talks An initiative IACO likely very soon he without elaborating Following London collapse we immediately reuters.unknown: V RM f reute b f AM REAGAN NDLD URGENT EMBARGOED

text.title: REAGAN ADMITS IRAN ARMS OPERATION A MISTAKE
text.body: President Reagan fighting to regain public confidence wake Iran arms scandal admitted tonight clandestine operation wound up as arms for hostages deal It mistake When came to managing NSC National Security Council staff let s face my style didn t match previous track record Reagan television address to American people I already begun correcting he added his prepared remarks Reagan s speech widely regarded as critical to his hopes repairing his presidency his first detailed response to week s scorching Tower commission report on secret sale arms to Iran diversion profits to U S backed contra rebels Nicaragua Reagan he been silent on scandal while he waited truth to come out admitted I ve paid price my silence terms your trust confidence He few months ago he told American people he did trade arms hostages month covert operation My heart my best intentions still tell me true but facts evidence tell me Reagan There reasons why happened but no excuses mistake he Reagan again original Iran initiative to develop relations those who might assume leadership post Khomeini government It s clear Board s report however I let my personal concern hostages spill over into geo political strategy reaching out to Iran I asked so many questions hostages welfare I didn t ask enough specifics total Iran plan he commission headed by former Republican Sen John Tower Reagan s intense compassion Americans being held by pro Iranian groups Lebanon resulted unprofessional unsatisfactory policy portrayed year old Reagan as man who did know or care much wide ranging probably illegal activities his National Security Council NSC staff hatched operation Reagan he endorsed all Tower commission s recommendations running NSC adding In fact I m going beyond recommendations so as to put house even better order He noted he appointed former Senate Republican leader Howard Baker as his new chief staff he hoped Baker help him forge new partnership Congress especially on foreign national security policies He his new national security adviser Frank Carlucci rebuilding national security staff with proper management discipline Reagan almost half NSC professional staff now consisted new people He FBI Director William Webster his new nominee to head CIA understands meaning rule law Reagan also announced Tower agreed to serve as member his Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board acts as watchdog on nation s covert activities But he he issued directive barring NSC staff itself undertaking covert operations No ifs ands or buts Tonight s speech far cry Reagan s initial strong defense his Iran policy televised speech November Reagan called charges he ransomed hostages undercut U S war on terrorism utterly false As recently as two months ago his State Union speech Reagan serious mistakes were made but defended basic policy as one worthy goals By contrast tonight s speech apologetic tone marked departure Reagan s usual upbeat confident demeanor He he took full responsibility his own actions and those my administration As angry as I may be activities undertaken without my knowledge I am still accountable those activities As disappointed as I may be some who served me I am still one who must answer to American people behavior Reagan Reagan message nation should move on come Republicans Democrats Congress allies around world and if we re reading signals right even Soviets His remark seemed to be reference to new Soviet willingness to reach agreement on eliminating medium range nuclear missiles Europe

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT INDONESIA S ECONOMY
text.author: By Jeremy Clift Reuters
text.body: Indonesia heads general elections six weeks time economy worst shape years economists officials government expects no spillover people power neighbouring Philippines to unsettle year rule President Suharto victory whose ruling Golkar party coming parliamentary elections assured However Western diplomats country s deteriorating economic position main threat to stability year s collapse oil prices dealt heavy blow to Indonesia halving revenue oil gas exports to billion dlrs year billion Oil gas account pct export income result run up to April elections Suharto far wooing his countrymen pay increases or tax cuts busy slashing budget spending government also recently increased transport fares frozen pay civil service army second year running despite inflation now estimated at pct current account deficit rose to billion dlrs billion while debt service ratio widened to pct pct Foreign debt repayments billion dlrs account almost third budget recent U S Embassy report on economy gross domestic product growth lowest since mid s when Suharto came to power Western economists GDP registered nil growth or contracted year after pct growth predicted only one pct rise year efforts to return to growth seen oil boom years s when economy grew average seven pct government now relying more on foreign borrowings Indonesia asked foreign governments to finance share new projects being built overseas money because cannot afford even to meet local costs three months Indonesia taken out new loans totalling billion dlrs on top external debt billion dlrs Western bankers more be needed country now ranks sixth among Third World debtors dlr commercial loan signed Tokyo December followed first week February dlr loan World Bank to support balance payments month Japan s Export Import Bank agreed dlr loan to meet Indonesia s share World Bank projects otherwise been scrapped or postponed More loans on way including two more World Bank worth total dlrs roads irrigation U S Ambassador Paul Wolfowitz recent speech economic growth remains key to preserving Indonesia s fundamental stability largest Moslem nation world Indonesia so far avoided some more extreme paths other Moslem countries But World Bank warned mounting unemployment could start causing severe social strains unless tackled annual report on Indonesia June unless economic growth revived unemployment could reach what termed unacceptable levels Unemployment officially put at pct at end year but those considered underemployed number around pct What path to take appears to be matter some dispute within Suharto s government his Western trained technocrats advocating more classic remedies supported by international financial community But another group supports protected economy more import substitution U S Embassy report government devalued rupiah by pct against dollar September to help exports curb imports currently working on series measures to further encourage foreign investment boost exports outside oil sector direction Suharto takes could affect Indonesia s ability to raise new loans future Western bankers say So far despite three packages economic measures over past nine months he touched key monopolies linked to businesses controlled either by his family or by business associates diplomats bankers say Diplomats investors now looking action on monopolies loss making state sector as signs Suharto serious tackling country s problems

text.title: GERMAN ECONOMIC OUTLOOK SEEN FAIRLY BRIGHT
text.body: The outlook West German economy relatively bright gross national product expected to expand by three pct year Kiel University s Institute World Economy GNP forecast by institute one five leading economic research bodies West Germany more optimistic than other institutes some recently reduced their GNP forecasts to between two pct report Kiel institute West Germany s export outlook deteriorated fundamentally despite mark s strength against dollar other major currencies The danger exports slump appears all all limited report On contrary slight rise exports can be expected institute past experience shown West German exporters move to counterbalance currency factors by cutting costs trying to penetrate new markets adjusting their product ranges They be aided by expected slight rise economic growth industrial countries At same time decline exports to oil producing countries looks set to slow year West German GNP growth be led by renewed advances domestic consumption investment spending both turn be buoyed by expansionary monetary policy institute However labour market see only slight improvement because companies be reluctant to hire additional workers due to higher labour costs caused partly by agreed reductions working hours institute cautioned expansionary stance monetary policy West Germany likely to bring marked acceleration inflation also warned what called worldwide synchronization monetary policy heightened risk new global recession central banks industrialized countries including Bundesbank followed Federal Reserve Board s expansionary course institute turn bound to lead eventually to rise worldwide inflation shift U S Policy towards more restrictive policy Other central banks were likely to follow suit causing recession could aggravate debt crisis developing countries as well as increase protectionism around world Although Germany cannot entirely shield itself negative effects global synchronization monetary policy should do all can to strengthen forces growth at home institute could be done by ensuring fiscal policy fosters willingness to work invest Taxes should be cut by greater amount than currently planned wage increases should be markedly lower than also Bundesbank should reduce inflationary pressures by cutting current rate growth money supply to four pct

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT POLISH SANCTIONS
text.author: By Irena Czekierska Reuters
text.body: Poland says U S Sanctions cost economy billion dlrs made clear wants Washington to take lead repairing damage after lifting remaining restrictions two weeks ago Polish officials unable to provide precise breakdown figure saying takes into account number hypothetical losses Some them too sophisticated to convert into financial terms one banking source But Western economic experts say effect sanctions impossible to calculate They say blurred by poor performance Poland s economy dismiss billion dlr figure as illusory Sanctions provided very useful excuse under achieving They did bad effect yes but they only contributed to largely internal economic problems one U S Imposed measures withdrew Most Favoured Nation MFN trading status Poland retaliation suppression Solidarity free trade union under martial law estimated cost to Polish economy originally devised several years ago by Institute National Economy offshoot central planning commission According to one Western envoy expert on Polish economic affairs extrapolated information on growth trends trade United States as well as increases credits Western commercial government lenders But calculations were based on time when trade booming credits still flowed freely he dismissing estimate as a theoretical projection based on high point no real scientific evaluation foreign trade ministry official Polish exports to U S late s averaged around dlrs annually fallen by half since sanctions were imposed Imports suffered slumping around dlrs to as credits ran out Poland dwindling trade surplus West year one billion dlrs against targeted billion official figures show Acknowledging sanctions lost Poland important U S Markets including agricultural equipment textiles chemicals some foodstuffs Western economists say credits dried up economic political reasons Poland accusing West letting economic relations deteriorate political reasons one expert It s illusion based on misunderstanding Western economy There s limit to how much you can go on giving someone who no hope repaying another adding Poland benefited global phenomenon easy credits s were no longer today s reality Describing billion dlr assessment as nebulous one diplomat also included losses hypothetical orders setbacks to Polish research through curbing scientific links exchanges Western officials say lifting sanctions new MFN status little impact on Poland hard currency debt billion dlrs lacks means to modernise industry MFN doesn t really mean anything only Poland be treated worse than other countries be difficult to regain access to U S Market because different forces play now one Western envoy He Polish products were competitive their quality too low Trade wars possible protectionist measures amongst U S Japan Europe also hamper Poland s efforts to regain entry Deputy foreign trade minister Janusz Kaczurba recognised fact recently Kaczurba told official PAP news agency recently Making up our lost position take long time be uncommonly difficult certain cases impossible period two to three years be possible to increase level exports by only dlrs While Poland unlikely to seek compensation says moral right to assistance U S says imposed sanctions illegally But Western economist The argument U S Sanctions were unilateral torpedoing Polish economy won t cut any ice Americans just reply Poles acted immorally crushing Solidarity Nevertheless Polish National Bank head Wladyslaw Baka talks Washington week International Monetary Fund IMF World Bank made clear Poland looking lead United States He quoted by PAP as saying Poland meet financial obligations to United States but short time without cooperative stand on part foreign economic partners He stressed U S had particular opportunity to play part cooperative policy Poland s partners interested settlement Polish debt Putting more sharply one senior banking official blamed Washington obstructing talks World Bank IMF Paris Club Western creditor governments recent years should now play more positive role As major superpower United States can influence international organisations he citing recent meetings aimed at stabilising currencies as example extent to Western nations were prepared to cooperate

text.body: The Bank France likely to cut money market intervention rate by up to quarter point at start next week follows steady decline call money rate over past days signals Finance Ministry time ripe fall dealers call money rate peaked at just above nine pct ahead meeting finance ministers Group Five industrial countries Canada on February restored considerable stability to foreign exchanges after several weeks turbulence call money rate dropped to around pct on February day after Paris accord then edged steadily down to eight pct on February pct on March where now stabilised Dealers Bank France intervened to absorb liquidity to hold rate at pct While call money dropped by well over percentage point Bank France s money market intervention rate remained unchanged since January when raised to eight pct pct bid to stop franc slide seven day repurchase rate also been unchanged at since raised by half point on January Bank France begun using seven day repurchase rate to set upper indicator money market rates while using intervention rate to set floor Sources close to Finance Minister Edouard Balladur he be happy to see interest rate cut dealers any fall intervention rate most likely to come when Bank France buys first category paper next Monday although earlier cut could be excluded cut seven day repurchase rate could come as early as tomorrow morning banking sources They recent high interest rates encouraged acceleration foreign funds returning to France discouraging authorities making hasty rate cut But they also pointed out money supply broadly back on target giving scope small fall rates M money supply government s key aggregate finished within government s three to five pct growth target rising pct compared seven pct

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC HONG KONG CD MARKET S

text.title: HONG KONG CD MARKET SHUTS DOWN AFTER NEW ISSUE
text.author: By Allan Ng Reuters
text.body: The Hong Kong dollar fixed rate market shut down afternoon after H K Dlr certificate deposit issue Chinese state owned Bank Communications Ltd Hong Kong branch suddenly surfaced bankers Disgruntled dealers market slowly on road to recovery after bout sell off began early February but still too fragile to absorb new issue Brokers new deal took them by surprise all major players stopped making markets existing issues fixed rate market consists mainly CDs tied to swaps or asset repackaging began to fall month ago due to indigestion after CD issues totalling billion dlrs flooded market January Bankers shake up result participants pushing market up too fast January amid intense speculation Hong Kong dollar s peg rate against U S Dollar soon be changed speculation depressed local interest rates unleashed flood new issues But speculation faded early February interest rates climbed as government remained adamant maintaining peg thus triggering adjustment on fixed rate capital market By late February market recovered considerably but Dai Ichi Kangyo Bank Morgan Guaranty Trust Co New York launched their issues pushed market down again Since then there been no new issues nearly two weeks until China Development Finance Co H K Ltd CDFC unit Bank China launched five year deal at pct quarterly interest payment mid afternoon today Brokers market steady early morning but began to slip marginally by late morning as rumours new issue circulated When deal launched major players quickly suspended trading refused to quote prices their own issues brokers We just don t know where market going European banker They Bank Communications issue traded at low but later pushed up to within basis point fee adding buying came mainly sister banks Bank China group official one Chinese banks deal launched at effective yield pct line market at time But European banker pricing issue present market conditionS the timing just right If banks more patience they wouldn t launch any issues now then market be all right another dealer But there no reason to be overly pessimistic he The effect issue on market should be as bad as what happened after DKB Morgan deals Despite criticism bankers CDFC still managed to recruit more than underwriters though composition group yet been finalised Any trader should recommend his bank against joining deal dealer But there other considerations such as relationship He admitted his bank joined as co manager banker he saw no reason why market makers decided to shut down if they were willing to join new issue Perhaps they were jealous first time Chinese entity taken sole lead position Chinese issue he Previously Chinese entities always acted as co lead managers whether Chinese or foreign issues

text.title: U S EXPANSION THREATENED CONGRESSIONAL REPORT
text.body: The U S economy facing several serious problems threaten continued expansion according to Congressional report released today report by Democratic majority Congressional Joint Economic Committee outlook sluggish growth U S rest world near future Committee Republicans released separate more optimistic report predicting continued stable growth low inflation Democrats to eight majority on committee made up Senators Representatives The annual report committee surveys trillion dlr economy whose tranquil appearance obscures danger signals lie just below surface Committee chairman Sen Paul Sarbanes statement A close inspection economy reveals current recovery while long fragile we skating on thin ice Maryland Democrat He danger signals included decline investment increased demand borrowing straining financial system possible increase inflation fueled by higher oil prices depressed condition nation s farmers Republicans most private economists saw no likelihood recession were predicting growth rate around three pct year next similar to Administration forecasts The economy appears to be on path stable growth We re comfortable current low rate inflation hopeful interest rates continue to decline optimistic employment opportunities continue to improve confident nation s resilient innovative diversified economy Republican report The greatest economic challenge facing th Congress reducing federal deficit Republicans added Democrats budget deficit should be reduced but also wanted government to spend more on education job training research development health care They pressures on dollar might make difficult Federal Reserve to use monetary policy to stimulate economy if becomes necessary There now substantial concern inflationary effects declining dollar buildup monetary pressure arising recent rapid growth money supply Democrat report At same time increased reliance on foreign sources capital American investment markets means Federal Reserve can no longer be as aggressive as past lowering interest rates driving dollar down Taken together outlook fiscal monetary policy thus very encouraging Democrats Democrats called on Administration to be more aggressive removing foreign trade barriers seeking new initiatives to solve international debt problem Democrats much U S trade deficit been caused by misalignment world s currencies especially overvaluation dollar began Both Democrats Republicans called policies to increase American productivity including incentives saving investment plant equipment development better educated work force
